title: Geologic time
description:
You are taking a geology class and the professor wants you to write a program to help students learn the periods of geologic time. The program should let the users enter a range of prehistoric dates in millions of years, and then output the periods that are included in that range. Within the program, represent the periods with an enumeration type made up of their names.

The periods of geologic time are:
Period Name      Starting Date (millions of years)
Quaternary          2.5
Tertiary                65
Cretaceous         136
Jurassic              192
Triassic               225
Permian              280
Carboniferous     345
Devonian            395
Silurian               435
Ordovician          500
Cambrian            570
Precambrian       4500 or earlier
input: One line with two numbers, representing the beginning and the end of the range.
output: The period names that are included in the input range in one line, separated by blanks.
author: Chapt 10
